intro: Schoepfia haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian Schoepfia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
